events.title: 13th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution Passed by Congress
events.description: The United States Congress passed the 13th Amendment, which abolished slavery in the US.
events.significance: This was a monumental step toward ending slavery and promoting civil rights in the United States.

events.title: Overthrow of the Hawaiian Monarchy
events.description: A group of American and European businessmen, supported by the U.S. military, overthrew Queen Liliuokalani and took control of the Hawaiian government.
events.significance: This event led to the eventual annexation of Hawaii by the United States.

events.title: League of Nations Founded
events.description: The League of Nations officially began operating with the aim of maintaining world peace after World War I.
events.significance: Though ultimately ineffective, it was the first international organization devoted to resolving conflicts peacefully and laid the groundwork for the United Nations.

events.title: Space Shuttle Columbia Disaster
events.description: The Space Shuttle Columbia disintegrated upon re-entry into Earth's atmosphere, resulting in the death of all seven astronauts aboard.
events.significance: This tragedy led to a suspension of the shuttle program and significant NASA safety reforms.
